sentences: Rev. Julius "June" Cheeks (August 7, 1929 â€“ January 27, 1981) was an American gospel singer, who enjoyed the majority of his success with The Sensational Nightingales.
His children are Rae-Sheaun Cheeks, June Cheeks and his daughter is singer Judy Cheeks.
He joined a local gospel group dubbed the Baronets and in 1946 he was spotted by the Rev. B.L. Parks, a former Dixie Hummingbird and tapped to join a group called the Nightingales.
To make ends meet Cheeks briefly joined the Soul Stirrers, rejoining the Nightingales during the early 1950s.

In the 1950s, Cheeks was ordained as a minister in the Church of Holiness Science in Detroit; Cheeks, who had dropped out of school at an early age, was largely illiterate for most of his life, but developed a profound knowledge of the bible via recordings on 78rpm gramophone discs.
After going into semi-retirement in 1960, Cheeks returned to action with a new group, the Four Knights.
